videoData.title: What makes technology so habit-forming?

nodes.whoTheyAre: Nir Eyal writes, consults and teaches on the intersection of psychology, technology and business.
nodes.whyListen: MIT Technology Review dubbed Nir Eyal "the Prophet of Habit-Forming Technology." He founded two tech companies and has taught at the Stanford Graduate School of Business and the Hasso Plattner Institute of Design. The author of Hooked: How to Build Habit-Forming Products, he blogs at NirAndFar.com and is a contributing writer for TechCrunch and Psychology Today.

videoData.description: About 40% of what you do, day in and day out, is done purely out of habit. Nir Eyal decodes how technology companies -- the masters of "habit-forming" products -- design the tech products we can't put down. But it isn't all negative manipulation, he says. It can and should be used for good.
